title: 'Masked Singer': Butterfly soars after (truly) shocking rehearsal, plus Skeleton unmasked!
text:
CLOSE The Panda was revealed during "The Masked Singer" and Robin Thicke jokingly guessed the unmasked star right. USA TODAY

Spoiler alert! This story contains details from "The Masked Singer" Season 2, Episode 4, including the identity of the eliminated celebrity.

Another "Masked Singer" bites the dust.

But, "don't be sad," host Nick Cannon said. "When we say goodbye to a character, we say hello to a star."

Six masked celebrities – Butterfly, Flamingo, Leopard, Black Widow, Skeleton and Thingamajig – returned to the stage Wednesday for their second performance of the season on the Fox show, offering judges and viewers another round of hints on their identities.

But a scary incident with Butterfly almost overshadowed the show after she experienced "a literal shock."

Here's what happened:

Last week on 'The Masked Singer': Jenny McCarthy was 'so close' to correctly guessing Eagle

Flamingo in "The Masked Singer" on Fox. (Photo: Michael Becker / FOX)

Flamingo

The pink bird shook up the competition with a choreography-filled performance of Kenny Loggins’ "Footloose." Jenny McCarthy was blown away by the singer's vocals. "I was smiling so big I thought you broke my botox."

But McCarthy said Flamingo's vocals may have given away her identity. "This week we got to hear a little bit more of your real tone. To me, immediately you screamed Adrienne Bailon." Robin Thicke stuck with his girl-group hunch, guessing Xscape's Kandi Burruss. Scherzinger thinks it may be Fifth Harmony's Ally Brooke.

Her clue? Flamingo came from "humble beginnings" and went from "hood-rat to Hollywood triple threat."

Leopard

Next up was Leopard with a rendition of Shawn Mendes’ "Stitches." Thicke said he "exudes glamour." McCarthy said the singer has "drag queen style" like RuPaul. Scherzinger piggybacked on her guess, adding that Leopard gave her "Billy Porter vibes with your mannerisms." Ken Jeong guessed Neil Patrick Harris before being shut down by his fellow judges. "No way! Neil is not that tall," McCarthy said.

His clue? "No matter what the world labels you, it’s never too late to flip the script."

Black Widow

The singer went country with Carrie Underwood’s "Before He Cheats" to get the judges "even more tangled up in my web." McCarthy got chills from her impressive vocals: "You did a phenomenal job, even with an injury." (The singer, who had her left arm in a sling, joked that "spiders shouldn’t ride hoverboards.”) Thicke picked Raven-Symoné because of a child actor clue. Scherzinger agreed, picking Disney alum Christina Aguilera.

Another clue? "Ever since I was an itsy bitty spider, I had to embody a squeaky clean image."

Skeleton

The boney contestant rocked out to Jet’s "Are You Gonna Be My Girl." Halfway through his performance, McCarthy confidently yelled out, "I know the voice!" She guessed Paul Shaffer because he played "second fiddle" during his career.

Scherzinger got "Vegas Vibes" from his rendition and picked magician Teller. Ken Jeong thought it was Martin Short following a "Three Amigos" clue. Thicke surprisingly agreed with Jeong: "I’m with Ken for the first time in my life.”

Skeleton's clue? "I was once inducted into the National Black Sports and Entertainment Hall of Fame." Scherzinger asked, "Do you have to be black to (be inducted)? I don’t know!"

There's no lazy bones in this #SkeletonMask! 💀 Check out their rockin' performance! #TheMaskedSingerpic.twitter.com/SxPHZG9aM5 — The Masked Singer (@MaskedSingerFOX) October 17, 2019

Thingamajig

The furry creature showed off his soft side with Kacey Musgraves’ "Rainbow." His performance moved Scherzinger to tears. "I don't know who you are, but you have a real gift," she said. The judges were seriously confused. "All of the clues say that you’re an athlete, but your voice is saying you’re a singer," McCarthy said before guessing Dennis Rodman. Thicke picked Dwight Howard, while Jeong thinks it’s singer Montell Jordan.

His hint? "My darkest moment was when I went to rehab." McCarthy quipped, "If that’s Dennis Rodman, I will shave my head during the show."

Butterfly

Last up was Butterfly, who brought down the house with Bon Jovi’s "Livin’ on a Prayer." Finishing her performance was a feat of its own after the masked singer got quite the shock during dress rehearsals. Butterfly explained that when the carbon dioxide stage effects went off during her song, "something short-circuited and I got electrocuted through the platform I was standing on."

"It was scary," Butterfly said, referencing her song: "I don’t want to be dead on a prayer, I want to be livin.'"

"We are happy that you are alive," Cannon added.

Butterfly in "The Masked Singer" on Fox. (Photo: Michael Becker / FOX)

McCarthy guessed Butterfly is Fantasia because of previous clues on church and isolation. Jeong thinks she’s a girl-group member. He guessed Spice Girls alum Mel B. Nicole went out on a limb and picked Twiggy because of a London background in the clue package. Thicke disagreed and picked Leona Lewis.

Her clue? "At the height of my career, I had everyone saying my name. But when I tried to spread my wings, I lost flight."

The Reveal

In the end, it was Skeleton who was sent packing after receiving the fewest audience votes and ordered to unmask. The judges final guesses? McCarthy picked Shaffer, Scherzinger selected Teller, Jeong thought Martin Short and Thicke also picked Shaffer.

When the mask comes off it's … drum roll please … Shaffer, the longtime musical director and band leader for David Letterman.

🚨SPOILER ALERT🚨 Only click this video if you're ready to find out who #SkeletonMask 💀 really is! #TheMaskedSingerpic.twitter.com/d14F4QSxu2 — The Masked Singer (@MaskedSingerFOX) October 17, 2019

"This is nuttier" than working with Letterman, Shaffer said. "It gave me a chance to try songs that I never would've thought I could pull off in real life. (The judges) had my number from the very beginning. … I don’t even know why I bothered."

Shaffer joins unmasked singers Dr. Drew Pinsky (Eagle), boxing champion Laila Ali (Panda), Olympic figure skater Johnny Weir (Egg) and gaming YouTuber Tyler "Ninja" Blevins (Ice Cream). Five celebs down, 11 to go.

'The Masked Singer': Robin Thicke (jokingly) guessed this unmasked star right!

description: Six masked celebrities returned to the stage for their second performance of the season, offering judges another round of hints on their identities.
